Exaggerate: The claim that Elizabeth Warren was paid $400,000 to teach one class at Harvard Law School is an exaggeration. While she did earn over $400,000 for her work at Harvard, it is incorrect to suggest that all she did was teach one class.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that Elizabeth Warren was paid $400,000 to teach one class.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the $400,000 payment was solely for teaching one class, without considering other work or responsibilities that Warren may have had at Harvard Law School.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim leaves out important context about the other work Warren was doing at Harvard Law School, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations for the payment she received.
